boardgame.description: From the box:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The gameboard is your battlefield. You have an army of men at your disposal and six bombs. Your mission--protect your flag and capture your opponent's flag._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Secretly place your men, bombs, and flag on the gameboard with these objectives in mind. But remember your opponent is doing the same thing, so you must plan a defense as well as an offense._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Once the armies are in place, advance your men. When you're one space away from an enemy, attack. You and your opponent declare ranks. The lower-ranking man is captured and out of play._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;You control your pieces and risk your men in battles where the strength of your enemy is unknown. The suspense builds as your men move deeper into enemy territory. Move with caution and courage. The next piece you attack could be a bomb. And when attacked, it could _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;blast_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; your man off the board and out of play._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The first to capture an enemy flag is the winner!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This game is similar to, and almost certainly derived directly from, the H.P. Gibsons (UK) game L'Attaque (1909). It is not exactly the same, but not far from it (numbered pieces, spy (same name) can kill the strongest piece but only when attacking, flag, bombs, etc.) This game in turn almost certainly drew on the classic Chinese children's game Jungle._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Re-implemented by:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Stratego (Revised Edition) (aka Stratego Fire _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Ice)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The Generals_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Stratego Legends_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Stratego: Star Wars_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Stratego: The Lord of the Rings_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Ultimate Stratego_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Electronic Stratego_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Stratego: Marvel Heroes_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Stratego: Star Wars Saga Edition_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Stratego: The Chronicles of Narnia_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;and numerous others._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Similar to:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Admirals_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Lu Zhan Jun Qi_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; L'Attaque_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Attack_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Batalj_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Sharpe's Attack_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Different Edition Complications_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;When first produced in Europe, the most powerful pieces had higher numbers. I.e. the Marshall (most powerful piece) was a 10, the General was a 9, and so on. The higher the rank, the higher the number._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;When they introduced Stratego in the USA, the numbering was reversed, so the Marshall was a 1, the General 2, and so on. The 1st rank (most powerful) was 1, the second most powerful was 2, 3rd most powerful was 3...._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Then, in 2000s Hasbro re-imagined Stratego in the USA and made a few changes. They reduced the number of pieces per side (from 40 to 30), added additional powers, and changed the numbering to reflect the European system._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This caused extreme consternation with many faithful American Stratego fans who preferred the 'old way'. (Actually the second oldest way, but whatever.) Many of these insist on playing Stratego with the 'Marshall 1 system'._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This wouldn't be a problem, except any and all discussions of Stratego are fraught with misunderstandings by those who are unaware of dual numbering systems! Keep this in mind when reading information about Stratego._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

STRATEGO by Milton Bradley 1977. Complete with 80 pieces, gameboard, inner tray cases, (rules on bottom of lid). Game pieces _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; board are in excellent condition and show very little wear. Box has a split corner, otherwise showing a little wear. Shipping weight is 4 pounds.

Wow! An oldie but goodie. This 1975 version in exceptional condition! Very minor wear on two box corners. Pieces in pristine condition. A nice addition to a vintage game collection. Will pay shipping/handling if purchased with Shogun together and in US.
Unopened and still in the shrink wrapping
1961 version with wooden pieces; box lid has 2 split corners, but is in great shape otherwise. Components are complete and in very good condition.
Opened but unplayed.
Opened, played only a couple times. Rare wooden box version.

All pieces present. Only played a couple of times. Box was stacked so the top/middle is slightly indented and one corner has a slight dent. However, the game is a newer version and the game looks great. Shipping is via US Priority Mail unless specified otherwise.
This is the very nice wood crate version. All complete, pieces look good and the wood crate box is in great condition also. Shipping will be 9.00.

Michael Graves design. OOP. **New** Mint in original box! (Box may have some small dents and dings due to the size of the box itself.) Note for shipping: I have not weighed the game, but it is heavy as the board is large and wooden.

I actually have two games. The 1962 version and 1970 version. If you want the 1970 version, offer me $5 and let me know you want the 1970 version. The 1962 game has damage to the box, both cover and bottom box. One side is torn and all the edges are repaired with tape. The actual face of the top is in pretty good condition. The 1970 version has much less damage to the cover, although there is still edge and corner wear (the corners are also torn). Both sets contain all the pieces and the boards are in good shape. I will ship to the U.S. for $13, and anywhere in the world for shipping plus $3. Also, to save shipping, check out my other games (here are some of them): 10 Days in Africa, 10 Days in the USA, Anachronism (various sets), Apples to Apples Junior 9+, Apples to Apples Junior!, Apples to Apples Expansion Set #1, Barbarian (double game with Survival), Before I Kill You Mr. Bond, Bible Challenge, Bitin’ Off Hedz, Bowl Bound, Brain Strain, Campaign, Caveat Emptor, Cheers, Circus Maximus (Battleline), Civilization (Avalon Hill), Clue, Compatibility, Cribbage Board (#29), Crime Busters, Desert Victory, Detroit-Cleveland Grand Prix, Dig-It!, Dilbert, Fluxx, Formula C Minus (new and used), Fortress America, Funny Friends, Gangsters Gun Molls and G-Men, Generations, Gold Digger, Grab!, Greed, High Ground (new and used), History of the Second World War (Part Two), How to Host a Murder – The Hollywood Premiere of Powar and Greede, Just Business, Killer Bunnies – Magic Carrot (Red and Violet), Knights of Charlemagne, Knockabout, Longstreet’s Assault, Lord of the Rings – The Duel, Mamma Mia, Manhattan, Mille Bornes, Mob Strategy, Montgolfiere, Murder Mystery Party (The Icicle Twist), Murder Mystery Party Kit, My Word! (regular and Junior), Name Burst, Neopets TCG, Od, Origins of World War II, Partyzone “Spy Ring”, Phase 10, Phlounder, Pirates (the constructible strategy game), Ploy, Power Lunch, Rack-O, Razzle, Read My Lips (Kid!), Red Empire, Rook, Rummy-Cue, Scan, Seafarers 5-6 Player Expansion, Serauqs, Settlers of Catan Card Game, Shogun (James Clavell’s), Skip-Bo, Solarquest, Space Shuttle, Stage II, Stellar Wars, Stock Market Game (AH – 1970), Stratego (1962 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 1970), Survival (double game with the Barbarian), Talk Show, Tennis, The Millionaire Game (for Glen Oak High School), Time War, Time’s Up, Trailer Park Gods, Tripoley: Criss Cross Poker, True Colors, Tumblin Dice Timberrr Junior, Twistgammon, Twixt, United Nations, Web of Gold, World of Wall Street and Zobmondo!!.
